task.summary: Default task
Hollow shell of an app with some tests.
Now it seems to be accessing the TuneIn site. The test is pretty bogus, because I won't be returning the entire tree, but it's nice to see something pass.
It's getting a list but one with lots of None's. I don't get this because my watch on [node.text for node in tree.xpath('//div[@id="container-1"]//div[text()]')] doesn't have all the None members.
I had put my hard-coded "fake it til you make it" in the wrong step!
Failing on the fake it til you make it, as it should be.

Passes for two-country case. The Fake It is the logic for only Peru or Myanmar.
Also cruft where I explore Python's lazy Boolean evaluation (short circuiting) and find I don't really understand it yet.
First meaningful failing test. No file yet created.
And now I faked it enough to pass again.
Failing test again: Now it wants an img tag in the file.
Passing (FITYMI): Hardcoded file with garbage img tag passes.
Passing for a slightly useful albeit very hardcoded HTML file.

Fail: Testing for images not in the hard-coding. (+refactored)
Again, the idea here is to test for a bit more functionality, to break the "fake it til you make it" (FITYMI) and force myself to

Pass: Basic functionality is there, though clearly in a messy HTML file.
Next: Refactor, maybe.
REFACTORED: Test steps; I should be requiring that relative paths work.

REFACTORED: One of my @when should have been @given.
Also the relative paths is an implementation feature. It should "just work" and I should test it from various places (although this is more a unit test than a behavior).

Messy test changes but copy testbed sorta works.
Trying to learn to use fixtures in behave, but sorta left that part unfinished and messy. Ignore the Firefox names; nothing to do with Firefox!

PASS, sorta, but there are some organizational issues with my tests.
The recursive tests should use the recursive setup but somehow I didn't set them up that way. That's completely leaving out the issue of what should be in fixtures, before_all, etc. instead of in steps.

Intermediate. Validates approach for file setup; most tests stubbed out.
This really is a mess of commented steps, early returns, skips, etc. But I wanted to show that I can copy this over and pass a test. - The steps with bad old code are now set to skip and return early. Soon I should refactor common code as appropriate rather than paste my fixes in. - I still have legacy comments of unnecessary stuff like make_testbed_writeable(). This became irrelevant when I created __store. - PyCharm is still having problems identifying regex steps, which means I added some hardcoded ones to troubleshoot.

Intermediate. Fixed bug that was producing empty glob.
And cleaned up a little bit of the cruft. Still some things that shouldn't be in there.
Incremental-Better step names.
FAIL. Why does only the optional period at the end invoke the step?

PASS (with too much skipping). Bug fix: greedy group was catching period.
Fixed the regex to disallow periods in the directory name although that may not be ideal either.
FAIL as it should. Recursion and arbitrary output both NYI.
FAIL but the recursion test case more or less works.
REFACTOR: Same test fails but now the App handles variable filenames.
REFACTOR. Start extracting image file names; using fixture.app tag.
PASS! Arbitrary location for output. (But do img tags in the file work?)

TESTS FAIL but the functionality now works. Tests need attention.
This suggests that my tests are too coupled to specific strings, not verifying real functionality (since recordings/output/thumbnails.html now has real functionality and the default thumbnails.html retained it, but that made the tests fail).
PASS! Relative paths now work.

INTERMEDIATE: Laying out framework for unit tests. Not real tests yet.
Philosophically I feel I should replace some of my BDD tests with unit tests. It's not that the BDD tests are bad, exactly, but exercising parameters (present or absent) feels like it pertains to unit tests.
INTERMEDIATE: Bogged down in generating meaningful tests of img paths.
INTERMEDIATE: Somewhat less broken, I think.

PASS: Bug. Didn't include root along w/ list of directories from os.walk
Took me a while--Key was that if I go back one directory from the one with the .image file then it passed the (still pretty flimsy) test.
Two tests are still skipped. Now might be a good time to start externalizing test data à la Django tests, no?
FAIL feature. I thought I just did an easy refactoring; apparently not.
